4️⃣ DIY Model: The DIY model of IKEA stands for Do it yourself. They provide guidebooks and assembly charts to support customers in installing their furniture thus reducing cost.
3️⃣ Independent Shopping: IKEA believes in promoting independent shopping. It is nothing but allowing customers to shop on their own. Thus, IKEA does not hire a lot of staff in its stores.
2️⃣ Bulk Production: IKEA produces all their furniture in bulk. Therefore, IKEA can get discounts on production and keep the prices lower.
1️⃣ Flat Packaging: In 1956, IKEA's founder introduced the "flat packing" technique that has now become its identity. Everything is packed completely flat so it costs less to store and transport.

6️⃣ Own products: Based on sales data DMart #manufacturers the maximum sold products under their brands. These products are very price competitive. For e.g. DMart Minimax
5️⃣ Volume Discounts: Due to high volume sales manufacturers also offer a volume discount reducing the purchasing price
4️⃣ Cash Discounts: DMart makes payments quickly to their manufacturers as a result they give a good cash #discount. Thereby cutting the purchase price of the goods.
3️⃣ No Rental Cost: Of all the existing stores to date, almost 80% are self-owned which eliminates the #rental cost.
2️⃣ Slotting Fees: Dmart charges a slotting fee to the brands for keeping their products on the shelf of Dmart. Thereby allowing it to offer the products at discounted prices.
1️⃣ No Middlemen: DMart Operates on a B2C model and eliminates intermediaries which mean eventually reducing cost. It helps the company to sell goods at a lower price.
